page.title: 02Worlebury Hill
page.content: Worlebury Hill is a large hill covered with woodland.The woods were planted in 1823 by Smyth Piggot,who was one of the wealthy people in Weston at the time.Some of the most common trees in the woods are the Oak,Sycamore and Ash.Before the woods were planted mining for lead and calamine was very popular.A long time before that there was an Iron Age Hill Fort,but unfortunately you can only see the remains today.It was inhabited by the Celts.To defend themselves the Celts made four ditches and walls repeated after each other.When they dug the big ditches they piled all the stones up behind them to make the walls. Eventually it was thought that the Romans took over the Hill Fort and destroyed it.We think this because some people found a skull with eight or nine sword wounds in it.
